title: How to Knit a Cable Cast On

steps.title: Make a slipknot
steps.content: Make a slipknot . Make a loop in the yarn. Make another loop and pull it through this loop. Pull the slipknot tight.

steps.title: Place the slipknot on the needle and pull it snug.
steps.content: Place the slipknot on the needle and pull it snug.

steps.title: Insert the right needle through the slipknot, as if to knit.
steps.content: Insert the right needle through the slipknot, as if to knit.

steps.title: Wrap the working yarn around the right needle as if you are going to knit.
steps.content: Wrap the working yarn around the right needle as if you are going to knit.

steps.title: Work a knit stitch, but do not slip the stitch off the left needle.
steps.content: Work a knit stitch, but do not slip the stitch off the left needle.

steps.title: Bring the right needle up and place the stitch onto the left needle.
steps.content: Bring the right needle up and place the stitch onto the left needle. Pull out the right needle. Now you will have two stitches on your left needle.

steps.title: Insert the right needle in between the two stitches on the left needle.
steps.content: Insert the right needle in between the two stitches on the left needle.

steps.title: Wrap the working yarn around the right needle.
steps.content: Wrap the working yarn around the right needle.

steps.title: Pick up the wrapped yarn with the right hand needle and pull it through the two stitches.
steps.content: Pick up the wrapped yarn with the right hand needle and pull it through the two stitches.

steps.title: Bring the right needle up and place the stitch onto the left needle.
steps.content: Bring the right needle up and place the stitch onto the left needle.

steps.title: Pull out the right hand needle.
steps.content: Pull out the right hand needle. You should have three stitches. This method is in line with European / Russian knitting technique. American knitters should additionally twist the right needle and then mount the stitch on the left needle so that it will be mounted correctly.

steps.title: Repeat steps 7-11 until you created the appropriate number of cast on stitches, lightly tightening the stitches as you go along.
steps.content: Repeat steps 7-11 until you created the appropriate number of cast on stitches, lightly tightening the stitches as you go along. You can make a small sample square of one inch to determine the number of stitches you should have. The number of stitches depends on the size of yarn you are using. For instance, a bulky or sport weight yarn will have fewer stitches than a fingering weight yarn. Another factor is tension or how tight or loose your stitches are when you knit.
